fields.Name: Skip AssociationDB - Engagement Matrix with Embedded Sparklines
fields.Description: Tests Skip's ability to create complex grid-based visualizations with embedded mini-charts (sparklines) and implement sophisticated drill-down patterns from grid cells.

InputDefinition.userMessage: Build me a matrix table showing member engagement across chapters and time periods. The rows should be our chapters (one row per chapter), and the columns should be quarters for the past 2 years (8 quarters total). Each cell should show the engagement score for that chapter in that quarter, with the number color-coded (green for high engagement above 75, yellow for medium 50-75, red for low below 50). Inside each cell, include a tiny sparkline showing the trend of that chapter's weekly engagement throughout the quarter. When I click on any cell, show me a bar chart breaking down the engagement by activity type (events attended, courses completed, committee participation) for that specific chapter and quarter. Then when I click on any activity type bar, show me a detailed table listing the actual activities - who participated, what they did, and when. Make every row in that activity table clickable to open the member, event, course, or committee record as appropriate. The matrix should have sortable columns so I can reorder by different quarters, and highlight the cell I'm currently viewing.

judgeValidationCriteria: Response includes matrix grid with chapters as rows and quarters as columns
Each cell displays engagement score with color coding (red/yellow/green)
Sparklines embedded in cells showing weekly engagement trends
Columns are sortable to reorder by different quarters
Clicking cell opens bar chart of activity type breakdown for that chapter/quarter
Bar chart shows events, courses, and committee participation counts
Clicking activity bar shows detail table of actual activities
Activity table includes participant names, activity details, and dates
Table rows support OpenEntityRecord for member, event, course, or committee records
Three levels of drill-down with clear context maintenance
